title: Apple Just Made Voice Memos Better with Layered Recording — Here's How It Works on iPhone 16 Pro
description: Apple introduced layered recordings in Voice Memos back in September, and the feature finally arrived with the latest update for the iPhone 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max. This exciting addition transforms the app into a versatile tool for musicians and storytellers, making it easier than ever to craft songs, narrations, or other creative projects. Imagine recording an instrumental track, then seamlessly layering vocals or a voiceover on top. Or take a lyric-filled recording and enhance it with live instruments. As you capture the second layer, the app lets you hear the first track through your... more
author: Justin Meyers

title: How to Export or Import Your Safari Browsing Data Between Browsers on iPhone, iPad, and Mac
description: Apple has introduced a valuable new tool for Safari that lets you export or import browsing data such as bookmarks, history, extensions, credit card information, and usernames and passwords. This makes it easy to move your data between Safari and other browsers like Brave or Orion, create a backup archive, or even sync Safari passwords with third-party managers like Proton Pass. This feature is available across iOS 18.2, iPadOS 18.2, macOS 15.2, and visionOS 2.2 — released on released Dec. 11, 2024. Whether you're backing up data, switching browsers, or staying organized across devices... more

title: From Clutter to Creativity: How Sarah’s IKEA Hack Keeps Her Home Organized
description: Living in a cozy 60 m2 apartment with her husband and three young children, Sarah, a home organizer and stylist, knows the importance of making the most out of every inch of space. “I hate a cramped feeling,” she says, “but I love doing arts and crafts with my kiddies.”  This passion for creativity and order led her to hack an IKEA BISSA shoe cabinet, transforming it into a multifunctional storage solution that also cleverly conceals an internet router.
